title: Add safe-area padding and compact routine containers

requirements.text: Add safe-area padding to the Header component to accommodate iOS Dynamic Island and Android notches/punch-holes, using CSS env(safe-area-inset-top) for proper spacing around device cutouts

quotes: Add safe-area padding to the header for iOS Dynamic Island and Android notches/punch-holes

acceptanceCriteria: Header has top padding that respects device safe-area-inset-top
Header content is not obscured by iOS Dynamic Island or Android notches/punch-holes
Safe-area padding is applied using CSS environment variables

requirements.text: Reduce the height of the Morning and Evening routine container elements by 50% in the MorningRoutine component to make them more compact while maintaining all existing functionality

quotes: Reduce the height of Morning and Evening routine containers in half to make them more compact

acceptanceCriteria: Morning routine container height is reduced by 50%
Evening routine container height is reduced by 50%
All routine functionality (drag-and-drop, checkboxes, add/delete) remains intact
Routine items remain readable and interactive after height reduction

constraints: Do not modify any UI elements or functions beyond the header padding and routine container heights
Keep all existing functionality intact, especially drag-and-drop and routine management features
Do not change color schemes, layouts, or other visual elements
nonGoals: Modifying backend logic or data structures
Redesigning the overall UI or theme
Adding new features beyond the specified changes
